questions.question: Why do you have to disable transformers if you want to measure reader performance?
options: Transformers always run slower than readers.
The log only reports the total workspace run time.
FME begins processing features through transformers as soon as reading begins.

questions.question: Which of the following methods works for measuring writer performance?
options: Running once with everything enabled, recording the total run time, then running with writers of interest disabled, and then calculating the difference.
Adding up the time elapsed for all writer-related INFORM messages in the Translation Log.
Disabling the writers and running the workspace.
Using a stopwatch starting when features enter the writer and finishing when the translation ends.

questions.question: Which of the following methods works for measuring transformer performance?
options: Running once with writers disabled, recording the total run time, then running with transformers also disabled, and then calculating the difference.
Adding up the time elapsed for all transformer-related INFORM messages in the Translation Log.
Disabling the writers and running the workspace.
Using a stopwatch starting when features enter the first transformer and finishing when the translation ends.
